Shrooms cause very mild hallucinations, although, it does depend on the species. APE shrooms tend to cause fuzzy and colorful vision about 1-2 hours after consumption, an object or face on a person might begin to warp or appear moving in an unnatural manner compared to a fully lucid mind shortly after. Trees begin to seem more significant and a trunk may appear to vibrate and become 2D if focused on, branches may look like they’re moving in an exaggerated manner like a strong breeze is flicking them up, down, and sideways. Honestly, shrooms make the world feel like a dream if taken in a bigger dose, which may seem either terrifying or very cool depending on you and your surroundings. Another thing I’ve noticed is the change in perception of time. An hour may feel like 5 hours and 5 mins can feel like 30 mins, extremely weird and very slowed down. But then again, it does vary from person to person.

All in all, it is a fairly pleasant experience if you have a good spotter or two and your environment is good. I’d recommend, for first timers especially, to sit outside with a couple of friends and just watch the sunset if you live more in a rural area, very peaceful, very awesome and gives a wide variety of sensations and pleasant hallucinations.

10/10 experience, but be careful and don’t overdo it.

Edit.
Another noticeable hallucination is the “copy and paste” hallucination, where things may appear to seem even more 3D than they already are, and almost seem as if they’ve doubled into a colorful vapor, like the meme where things are copied and pasted on top of one another. The final hallucination is the perception of “more”, where one thing may become many and that includes eyes, bugs, etc. dependent upon where you may be. Again, this may seem scary, but it’s very fascinating and as long as you are aware that it’s not real, then you’re good. Just have fun with it, don’t let it turn you off because that can lead to a bad trip.

I took shrooms for the first time with my best friend yesterday. I wanted to be comfortable and in nature so we had a little picnic in a park. Best experience in the world. We had the shrooms in tea with honey it was very yummy. At first I felt very drowsy and weird. But soon the sky looked friken beautiful, my friend looked like the coolest person in the world, all colors intensified, and perception looked different than usual. We ended up having the most deep conversations and crying happy tears, it really just made me realize that things aren’t that big of a deal and calmed my anxiety. I don’t think I took enough to have hallucinations, but I’d love to try. I would advise not to try shrooms in a closed room unless there is something to keep you simulated or something fun to look at. Don’t do it around people you can’t fully express yourself around, and honestly I would suggest doing it with only 1-2 people. It’s important to have a person with you in case you begin to hallucinate and freak out so they can calm you down. And overall I think it’s best to do it in the daytime because colors look so beautiful. If your intention is to love shrooms, you appreciate things about the world around you, and you don’t often think of dark dark scary shit all the time, I’m almost positive you won’t have a bad experience. I felt so weird at first but I just calmed myself down and my friend reminded me that it’s normal to feel weird because it’s a friken psychedelic. Anyways, 10/10 experience, I’m sad I can’t go back to yesterday right now haha.

Currently on shrooms. I literally took 1 cap. I have taken shrooms MANY times, but for some reason, this time was different, as in, more introspective and anxiety inducing. I was on the verge of an anxiety attack many times this evening. I'm probably on hour 3. Time has gone by SO slow. Effects so far: thoughts all over the place, major anxiety, feelings of I don't even know what. I have no appetite; food sounds gross. Honestly, even looking at my phone doesn't seem right, but I'm doing it as a distraction because I'm scared of my own thoughts and because I'm alone and it's night time. I usually love shrooms because they make me laugh and feel good, but this time, I feel straight up sick, anxious and crossfaded. I have cried twice because I'm so in my thoughts. All of my repressed trauma from my past relationship is coming out and I feel hurt. Shrooms, eh.

Definitely something to try if you have PTSD, Anxiety, or Depression. If you want the benefits of psilocybin without “tripping”, micro dosing is a great option.

I recommend starting with the intention to learn more about yourself and the world.

Remember that bad trips can turn into good ones if you allow it. I suggest cooling yourself down with a fan, drinking water, and putting on some light “feel good” music. Play something calming, not aggressive.

Avoid listening to any music with the topics of violence or unaliving one’s self. I typically just turn my Spotify onto a playlist without any explicit music in it. Classical music is a fantastic option as well.

Go small, and go slow. Enjoy the ride, and be safe y’all ❤️

TL;DR I fell into hell

The last trip I had was mostly great. The visuals were amazing (Vikings and mermaids in my grass, the bricks of my house were also dancing) but the part I remember most, is the part that went terrifyingly bad for me.

I was laying on my bed, almost completely physically merging with it until I felt this heat from below me, at first it was uncomfortably warm then to sweltering hot and finally, it felt like my skin was dripping off my body. I blinked and I couldn't open my eyes and I fell through my bed and into darkness.

All I saw once I was able to see was a red sky with black clouds and I turned around to see below me, nine descending, tiered rings, not jewellery but land, the further in they went, the smaller the rings became.

Even with the air rushing past my ears as I fell, I could hear screaming, but not from one single person, but trillions of people (some of voices I recognised as people I knew, my dad died in 2010 and I could hear him, screaming for help.) And the smell, oil, burning flesh and smoke, literally every breath.

I closed in on the icy bottom and smacked into it. Then found myself floating in a hallway with the walls made of flesh (at this point it was freezing cold) for reference, imagine an ant walking through a hall way inside a house.

I was pulled through the darkenss and I could feel something in front of my, Infinitely larger than myself and I couldn't see it.

It said to me "what are you doing here? You're too early to be here."

I thought at the time, "dude, this totally isn't real, I'm high af right now and this is actually insane."

And this is where I went from thinking it was a wild hallucination to loosing my grip on reality, it said back to me, "this is real. You remember our deal, I will come for you, eventually."

I panicked, severely and it kept saying, "if you don't open your eyes and wake up, you'll never leave this place."

I completely lost it and couldn't tell what was real, everything I was seeing, feeling, hearing was all real. I tried to open my mouth and call out to the other person in the house who was my sitter but it wouldn't open. A few seconds later, I was ripped upwards, back up through the nine rings, ascended through what looked like dirt and rock and jolted up into my bed.

My sitter took an hour to convince me that what I was seeing was real and that where I just went wasn't.

I've taken this 3 times now. the 1st was great. 100% agree with that spiritual experience. the 2nd I went into it after being not so nice to my girlfriend so my mindset wasn't the happiest. We have these cool light things that look like moving space nebulas projected on the ceiling and we look at that and see some cool stuff. but that time when I pissed my girlfriend off, I started to see the villains from the 80's cartoons in the lights. It definitely was me telling myself that I was an asshole and after thinking about it when I came down, all the villains from the 80's were evil just to be evil. They are not the villains of today where they have reasons to be. So that hit me hard because I was being an asshole to my girlfriend just to be one. I came out of that with a completely different outlook on how I should bbe treating my girlfriend and I havent done something like that to her since. the 3rd time was a lot of fun but not as spiritual as the first. The weird thing about it is that you cry, A LOT. but not a sad crying, just your eyes are crying and you dont even know why. The thing about that is that your body releases all the stress chemicals through tears, so after you are done with your trip and you've cried a gallon of tears without feeling sad but really happy, you are SO much less stressed in life.  There is also no hang over or anything and it feels like you are actually seeing things for how they really are, instead of other drugs or alcohol that mask how you see the world. My GF used to be on anti depressants and anti anxiety medication when I met her, and now she is completely off of them and she has said she is the happies she has ever felt in her life. All that after only 3 trips. I highly recommend going camping in the woods with your partner and giving this a try during the day. they say "its 10 years of relationship therapy in 4 hours".

3am, passed out on the deck under the boom of a rented (by someone else) sailboat in the BVI's, horribly wasted on local shrooms and whatnot. Waking up, the deck felt like it was shaped like a traffic cone and if I made the slightest move I'd tumble off into the sea. Looking at the shore, the hills were filled with red and blue eyes glaring at me (they knew..oh they all knew!). I crawled on my stomach, terrified, dragging myself along the sheets with my face buried and eyes clenched shut for what seemed like ages (on a 42' boat.. maybe all of 10 feet), until I got to the cabin and just slithered over the side head first and tumbled down the steps. Then I rolled myself into a ball in the corner of the bunk and stuffed the sheets behind and around me for protection. Somehow, nothing found and devoured me, and I survived the night again. Repeat with minor variations until week is over, go home. Excellent restful vacation.

Just sharing my experience with those who may be interested in trying it. I did it for the first time yesterday.

I had about 3g worth and I'm considered 'normal' (no mental conditions). It was honestly a good time. Personally, it was very different to my expectations. I expected this otherworldly experience, tripping out of my mind thing, epiphanies etc. Don't get me wrong the epiphanies did come, but not in this revelation type way the media puts it out. Rather than feeling like you yourself are tripping or being affected, it feels like the environment itself is having some alternations from reality. It is not like another world where everything is distorted but more like some distortions within the normal 'reality'. You also feel very much in touch with ur environment, I spent most of it on the porch surrounded by my plants and even stepped into the rain for a bit. I can see the wanting to do it in nature appeal. The visual distortions were honestly beautiful for me, as people before said do it in a calming environment and with people, you feel comfortable with. I can see how people can 'tunnel' as well, ie let a train of thought carry them away, one thought around an emotion can lead to other thoughts surrounding similar emotions, but it allows you to understand them and everything else in greater depth. For me the underlying theme was that everything is a process and whether things happen for good or for bad, it will all be okay in the greater scheme of things, and 'importance' really isn't that important... basically, a sense of acceptance and your place in the world is manifested. That as I said before isn't a revelation type experience but more something that was cultivated just by doing you while going through the experience. Hope this helps.

I ate 30 grams.

First things got weird, everything become covered in some type of colorful, dancing aztec patterns. The walls, the floor, everywhere I looked. Proportions changed, everything seemed to move slightly back and forth or wobble a bit. The sensation was very shroomlike. Letters starting shifting and moving, becoming a blur of letters on a page. My hands had the same sort of aztec patterns as the walls, and I felt I could go infinitely deep into these patterns in my hands. They increased in complexity the closer I looked.

Then it hit even harder. I realized I took way too much, and I was struggling to think straight. Things were very disconnected. I could not make sense of anything. At this point I just wanted the effect to go away, so I laid down and waited for stuff to calm down.

While I was laying down and breathing, struggling to make sense of anything, I had some weird thoughts in my mind. I had the feeling all patterns in my life were destroyed, like the divide between days, the divide between work and free time, the divide between activities. I felt this feeling would last forever and my life would be totally without structure forever. Meanwhile I was focussing on breathing, waiting for the effects to wane.

I decided to grab food, to wash down the shrooms and dilute them. Every step through my house was weird. Every step was a new world. When I had a glass of water, that crystal glass and clear water became my whole perception. I was in a crystal dimension. I put it down, back in the messy kitchen dimension. Everything I did was a dimension in itself. It absorbed into my entire being. I laid down again, absorbed into thought.

This felt like hours upon hours had passed of me just laying, breathing and being in a very weird place mentally.

When the effect eventually did die down a bit, I felt euphoric for making it through. I sat on the couch still seeing all the patterns and dancing wobbling things, but happy that I could finally think straight again. I felt a sense of profound euphoria, like I had just been on a journey and got safely back home again.

It was pretty whacky, but nothing like some people report. I do realize though, just how scary this could be had I been in a worse place mentally. You can become ABSORBED by a certain thought process, even a subconscious one. If that is a bad one, you will be in hell.

If you're ever having a bad trip, it's the shrooms telling you that something needs to change. Whether it's where you are in the moment (a dark and scary forest compared to a hillside while the sun is rising), or the people you're with (strangers/acquaintances compared to people you have known and trusted for years), or the final thing which is something about yourself internally that has to give. If you are a very uptight person and everything has to be a certain way, shrooms will beat you to the ground and not let you up. Why? Because psychedelics is about letting go and being able to take the passenger seat of life. If you go into your trip with a good mindset, you are in a good setting, and you have the right person/s with you, I promise you'll come out of that trip with a better understanding of yourself as well as the beautiful world around you.

People act like you don't control how you percieve and act on shrooms, if you see the bad stuff, it's your brain sending you a sign, it forces you to accept your problems and move on with them as a part of your identity, i always tell myself that if i badtrip it's because i needed to.

Having taken them several times now, my experience can definitely confirm the positive effects of magic mushrooms. I have yet to have a bad experience but I do know and acknowledge that they are out there. I wanted to give my own anecdotes to provide others looking to walk the same path with information that might persuade them to do something that I think every consenting person should at least try once.

As explained in the video, they cause your brain to produce new patterns of thought. By doing so, it necessarily removes your thoughts from having to hurdle all of the cultural conditioning that played a determining role for you before you ingested the mushrooms. Without the effects of socialization determining how you identify with yourself and the world around you, you necessarily begin to understand that the nature of reality is far from what you have been cultured to perceive. Magic mushrooms force your brain into an ego death where you are able to reorient your identity with all of the knowledge you have gained throughout life, but absent of any of the external pressures that were present before.

My own interpretations of my experiences have led me to believe that life and non life are merely extensions of the same thing, the universe. Any ideas that posit relative value are entirely subjective to the human mind. There is no objective fact about reality that differentiates value between rocks and trees and people and galaxies. Rather, they are all varying symptoms of the spacetime continuum. This has allowed me to make tremendous progress in how I perceive the world around me. Morals and virtues I now understand to be subjective cultural constructs that are dependent upon the mind's capacity to conceptualize meaning. I now understand the extent to which personality is determined by social structures and relationships, especially parenting, religion, friends, partners, and the greater umbrella of cutlure. With this understanding I have crafted a new standard for my own identity to live up to that maintains a conscious acknowledgement of what it means to be human and how out of our control our brains actually are.

I now view myself as a being capable of virtue with the necessary biological mental faculties to produce the drive to be virtuous. I am born from the nihlism of the chaos of the universe and the quantum interactions that produce it, but instead of acting as though there is no greater meaning, I have been given the capacity to create it for myself.

however, our consciousness is not the only entity that stands in objection to nihilism, for the universe itself produces order amongst the chaos, but without a collective awareness for the awareness is within ourselves, in our egos. The universe is therefore god, and being that I am the universe, an awakened amalgamation of stardust, in this regard I too consider myself god. I am both of the void and naturally existing in opposition to it. Every human has this potential, and through normalizing the spiritual connection to the universe, I think we can also normalize a worldview that forces nihilism to submit itself to our will as we all become gods. Shrooms are quite literally a cheat code for enlightenment.

I’ve done shrooms plenty of times. The visuals depends on how much you take. It can also make you feel sick for a short period of time. The trip can last up to 8 hours. What does it feel like? Depends n dosage (obviously) in the first 2 hours after eating. You’ll feel a body high. After that you feel a bit drunk. It can also make it to where you aren’t going to walk or move much. It all depends on you. It can scare the crap out of you. That is called Ego Death experience. Can it kill you? Technically yes. You can scare yourself into a heart attack. Can it kill you? No. No such thing as overdose either. The visuals is more or less just waves and colors seem more colorful and bright. Your brain will be thinking a million things at once. Then it becomes a here and now moment. Medically. Shrooms is good for Anxiety especially for those with social anxiety. It helps with depression and PTSD. Fun fact as well. Shrooms became legal during the first part of the Covid-19 pandemic because it was helping patients. There is so much we don’t know. But there is a lot we’ve learned. Biggest tip. If you are having a bad trip or just not feeling up to par with it and feel uncomfortable. Just lay down in front of an Air Conditioner or fan. The cold will distract you from what’s happening. Watch a movie and you’ll be fine. Remember the bad trip only lasts as long as you let it and will pass in less than an hour. Stomach will also pass. Just know you are fine and everything will be okay.

Magic mushrooms are God's true sacrament, and used to also be the sacrament of the Catholic Church. Think about it, all the Catholic traditions regarding the sacrament that make no sense for unleavened bread. They fast before the sacrament, which makes magic mushrooms work much better. They take it once a week to build back up tolerance. They are forbidden to work or trade on their sacramental day, which no one wants to do while tripping. They have to confess their sins before taking the sacrament, makes no sense for bread, but that would definitely keep them from having a bad trip in a religious ceremony. They keep the sacrament in tabernacles of gold and silver, dry dark places, perfect for storing dried mushrooms. They continually refer to the bread as the body and wine as the blood, while a mushroom actually has a body and blood, and the blood can be boiled into water to make magic tea, or "holy water."

At some point in the Catholic history, the true sacrament was hidden from the people. This most likely happened during the Second Great Schism when there were two Popes, and the French Pope usurped the real Pope around 1417. Seventy years later the Inquisition happened, when they would have hunted down and killed anyone who still used magic mushrooms as the sacrament. It also makes sense that missionaries were able to spread the Gospel armed with a real sacrament like magic mushrooms, rather than some stale bread. That wouldn't really impress too many of the people you are trying to convert. Interestingly, they seem to have replaced the intoxicating effects of mushrooms with wine in their ceremonies, which actually has the opposite effects. Mushrooms make you smarter and spiritually mature, but alcohol does the opposite. Clearly, Satan had something to do with that choice.

If you’re going to trip just know it might not always be fun. It takes a relaxed personality and being willing to just let go and let it run the course. At high doses you’re at the whim of your imagination. If you get scared about what you’re feeling it could go badly fast.

Always do shrooms and acid in a place you’re familiar with and feel 1000% safe and comfortable unless you want the risk.

I have never had a bad trip, whether I did it alone or with my friends. However every time I’ve done it with my friends one of them had a bad experience. One of them convinced themselves that they’ll “never be normal again” and was paranoid the entire time.

Once you consume them, you need to completely surrender to them and accept your state of mind for hours to come. It’s not like smoking some weed where you can just take a nap.

i remember i did shrooms once with some friends in a large open park. Everything was spiritual, peaceful, humble, wholesome and forgiving. I remember just how beautiful nature and the overall world was. During this time i had complete disregard for technology and human civilisation for example for that whole 8 hours i barely touched my phone and i completely lost sense of the distant sound of cars and other ambient noise caused by humans going on in the distance. It felt as if my friends and i were in an isolated Utopian environment within nature. I also cherished the relationships i had with my friends at the time and how lucky we all were to have eachother and tbh i still have that feeling which i took away from the experience of a strong sense of gratitude for the friends i have and the life i live. I won't do shrooms again not because they were bad, but in my own neutral opinion that one experience was en lighting and meaningful enough for me, and i have no real craving to do it again. I simply was happy and glad about the experience i had on shrooms and was satisfied enough.

Did some for the first time yesterday, and I had a seizure for the first time in my life. I'm 24 in September, with no history of epilepsy. Any idea what could have caused it? Before you ask if I'm sure it was a seizure, the answer is yes, I'm 100% sure. I was playing World of Wacraft and listening to music while in Discord with friends, literally was just vibing and having fun, then I grabbed my phone to message someone, and everything went black. I either completely or almost completely lost consciousness. The only things I remember are touch sensations. I remember the feeling of my arms and legs shaking incredibly hard and smacking into the chair and desk I was at/in. I remember the feeling of my back slamming into my chair so hard that it actually aches to breathe today. I was told I also yelled pretty loudly, but I don't remember doing this. When my family came to check on me, I was slumped down in my chair. I could not hear or see at all during this and was unaware of how much time had passed. When I started to gain consciousness, it took maybe another 10 to 20 seconds before I could move my arms and legs again, however it felt like a life time.

Be safe and be with friends or family who can watch you and take care of you when you trip, guys. I do not regret taking shrooms, no one could have known that would have happened, and after the seizure, the trip itself was not terrible, but it was certainly impacted by how terrified I was over having a seizure.

We all have our own opinions, because of huge population size makes each user have a unique trip while we all might share some of the same leaning and visual experience.
Let’s start with Anxiety/Depression, these drugs can give off such a powerful sensation feeling of life that it can possibly cure you temporarily.
For some this powerful feeling of what they are seeing with there eyes can cause a panic/anxiety attacking leading to negative trip, not everyone has a stable mind, visuals, sounds, body effects can be scary to users who have no idea what they are getting themselves into.

Addiction: after I tried these drugs I was a clean soul for about a 1 week, no drinking alcohol, no smoking at hookah lounge , stopped taking pills (all sorts of them) and started eating healthy and drinking plenty of water, but this rebirth type feeling went away after a while then I started getting back into my same old habits, so I can say yes it stopped my addiction temporarily.
Now if anyone is curious is these drugs are addicting then I would say definitely not, it’s so powerful to the point where you may never do it ever again for the rest of your life, but sometimes we just want to get back up there and see if we still had it in us. Each time I did a psychedelic drug was always months/year apart from each other, crazy drug and I don’t regret anything about it
and I’m thankful to the person who showed me and told me to try them, it’s crazy how in life all this stuff exists but all it takes is one person to show you then you show someone else and a chain begins. 🌍

I once had an incredible experience months after having a powerful Shroom trip. A dream transitioned into something I perceived to be very real.
Of which I suspect the involvement of DMT. It started whilst I was in the midst of a dream, my dog that passed away long ago suddenly appears in this dream. After we greeted each other, I went with him knowing that we were about to transition to a world beyond what I knew, but I had no idea what to expect. As I went with my dog, I kept thinking how sure I was that I was going to leave this existence. There wasn't a single thought of doubt, It's like I was in the right mindset to trigger what was about to happen. I remember it transitioned from white to black, my vision stayed black for a little while whilst holding onto the thought. I was completely calm.

And that's when it hit me. The dream suddenly transitioned into something that had such intense stimulus of all my perceptions. What I mean is, it wasn't a dream anymore. And It felt more real than being awake. I heard the sound of an explosion, rumbling, my mind expanded and my body vibrated. I remember complex visuals scattering, though nothing specific. Accompanied by high pitched noises. It very much seemed like I was in some kind of tunnel. At a certain point of going through this transition, I felt I was going to die if I went further. As soon as I resisted death, I woke up calmly and clear headed, in awe ofcourse of what just happened. Apart from my big shroom trip, this was the most incredible thing I ever experienced. I wonder what would of happened if I chose to go all the way.

Hi Magic School Bus, I think your podcast had a pretty interesting topic (benefits of drugs) and I agree that it is definitely something to be considered. I was first curious about approaching this situation from a scientific standpoint, so I began an inquiry regarding the reactions that occur when using psychedelic drugs. I completed a fair amount of research on this and found the following:

According to the article “The Essential Guide to Psilocybin Mushrooms”, psilocybin is the main reactor causing hallucinations in “magic mushrooms”. After consumption, it is metabolized into a substance known as psilocin, which then targets serotonin receptors that carry signals throughout the brain. It is mainly used for evoking more emotional response from the user, unlike antidepressants which decrease receptivity. For this reason, many scientists believe “shrooms” could take the place of antidepressants as a better solution to mental illnesses. To some, this might be the case, but others’ experiences dictate otherwise. As mentioned in your podcast, several people have made dangerous, irrational decisions under the influence of psilocybin mushrooms. The brain is wired into an altered experience where it is unable to properly interact with its environment, so evidently, it can result in what users have defined as “bad trips”.

Some antidepressants, similar to psilocybin mushrooms, also interfere with serotonin in the brain. Others rely on neurotransmitters to balance chemicals which regulate the user’s mood and concentration. Although different than magic mushrooms in many ways (price, contents, etc.), they both cause a distorted reality which will (normally) release users from suicidal or harmful thoughts. There are numerous types of these prescribed drugs, with the most popular brands including Prozac, Celexa, Zoloft, Paxil, and Lexapro. These drugs are often prescribed to help treat conditions such as depression and can improve the condition of patients. However, they have also been known to cause side effects such as weight gain, fatigue, and sometimes even seizures. Also, looking at Canadian statistics, around 86 per 1000 people take a daily dosage of antidepressants.

Looking at both of these drugs, I’d say that neither are 100% safe, but can be of use to someone suffering from a mental disorder. With that in mind, it really depends on the individual, with each person undergoing a personalized experience. From a personal standpoint, I can't say I am familiar with either of them, but after listening to this week's episode of the Magic School Bus, I think I have an adequate understanding. Plus, I also thought it would be fun to explore more factors within this situation.

Another idea to consider is price. According to the Drug Enforcement Administration, psilocybin mushrooms tend to average around $100-120 per ounce and $20 per eighth of an ounce. The brand Celexa, on the cheaper side of antidepressants, costs about $80-100 per month for a daily dose of 40mg (roughly 0.04 ounces total). A more expensive option, Prozac, charges $160-295 monthly for a daily dosage of 40mg (also around 0.04 ounces total). Examining these by cost in relevance to mass, magic mushrooms definitely have an edge on price. Perhaps something you may want to look into is the frequency that users consume “shrooms” and how that affects the overall price?

One last thing to add -what about counselling and therapy? In my opinion, it’ seems to be a much more reliable way to cope with/fix a mental illness and I personally would put more trust in an interpersonal relationship than a prescription. Although I understand that everyone is faced with a different situation, I cannot comprehend why so many Canadians (8.6%) are using antidepressants (with others in possession of psilocybin mushrooms) when therapy exists. I suppose the right question would be: What factors cause mentally ill individuals to turn away from counselling and instead pursue questionable drugs?

Thanks for your insight on the topic, I hope that you’ll consider my thoughts for a future episode of your podcast. I have linked a handful of resources below that I found to be useful for researching and I look forward to your next episode.

Shrooms saved my life. I would like to share my story of using shrooms for the first time ever but you must know my backstory. I was born to a teen parent, always struggling since I was a child, my mom could not pay for a licensed babysitter so in turn I was always going to random peoples houses to be looked after. Ages 6-14 I was always sexually abused by the people who were supposed to be looking and caring after me. This caused me to have severe depression, severe anxiety, and to be extremely anti social. I never went to therapy, we could never afford it. All my life after the sexual abuse and also the physical and verbal abuse from my own mother, it made me self harm and want to always kill myself. I tried 3 times before I turned 16. God wanted me to live so those attempts failed. My mom was never supportive ever. I had to tell myself to get good grades, to pass my classes and to graduate high school. I basically raised myself. My entire life has been a shit hole. I would cry every night until I was 18. I met a gentlemen who showed me what it’s like to be loved. I never knew what real love was. I finally opened up another my past to him and he listened. 5 months before I turned 22 he sat me down and told me about the benefits shrooms can give you. I was very hesitant as I think if it is illegal I will not consume it. He convinced me to try it just once: I did. I took the shrooms 6 days ago. I do not cry anymore. I do no zone out like I always would and go to “the bad place”, just my brain replaying all the abuse in my head from the past, it went AWAY. Now when I do zone out, I simply daydream about happy things. I can get out of bed every morning without thinking to myself “well if I kill myself I don’t have to get out of bed”. Shrooms has saved my life. Please, if you have troubles, this can seriously help you. Tomorrow will make one week where all the depression, anxiety, suicidal thoughts have gone away. Even just once , can maybe save your life too.

I recently took mushrooms for the first time. It wasn't really anything like this for me, since I was laying down for most of it and closing my eyes. Yes, there were some minor visual and auditory hallucinations, but the most unusual part was the sheer mental journey. I think all the information talks about the hallucinations because the other part is so difficult to explain. I was able to evaluate my relationships, my behaviors, my purpose in life, and see everything through a new lens. I was able to be more grateful for everything I've been given. I was able to fully process trauma and the death of loved ones. Things that I didn't think were a big deal or that I thought I had dealt with emerged and I was able to confront them and accept them. With proper preparation and guidance, I think mushrooms would be great for anyone.

Psilocin does not prevent the reuptake of serotonin (AKA it does not inhibit SERT-- this is part of what SSRIs do). It does, however, act as a receptor agonist on a number of serotonin receptors, with the 2a receptor being the primary suspect for the visually hallucinogenic effects. In being a receptor agonist, psilocin inhibits serotonin from stimulating serotonin receptors because it is blocking the receptor by virtue of being inside of it.

I'm not an expert, just experienced user but basically, the only downside explained in the video is "bad trips". Two things about bad trips. First, taking Psilocybin under proper set and setting makes the probability of bad trips almost non-existent. Set meaning the proper mindset. For example, if you have a lot of negative thoughts they can carry over into and be amplified by the trip. A trip should usually only be taken by someone of sound mind with a clear purpose (introspection, relaxation, party or whatever else). Setting meaning you're in a comfortable place like your home and with people that you're comfortable with. I don't know the details of how the trials were accomplished but I'm willing to bet people where in environments they weren't used to surrounded by people they don't know studying them, and even with that only then 22%.

Second. I've had what a lot of people consider to be "bad trips". Though I chose to have these trips. Specifically, I chose to face some military-related PTSD issues while under the influence, with a shaman and the trip helped me to be at peace with what happened. On bad trips though, those deeply involved in the community tend to say "There are no bad trips, only challenging trips.". Everything a trip shows you is something that's in your head and sometimes facing the things in your head that you aren't comfortable with actually makes for the most therapeutic trips. I'd choose a challenging trip over a good trip any day as they've always made me a better person.

The informative nature of this is great but why has the cartoonist drawn Liberty Cap shapes with the telltale Amanita Muscaria (Fly Agaric) red colour with white spots? Amanita Muscaria have mind-altering properties of their own but contain no Psilocybin or Psilocin whatsoever. They are also wildly unpredictable in terms of their effects and could result in some serious discomfort, or if taken in the wrong way or in too high a dose could cause liver problems. Some serious lack of research was done in this respect and if any other woefully uninformed people get inspired by this and go eat some Amanitas, thinking they are Psilo containing then that could be potentially damaging or at best completely misrepresent what this video is trying to achieve. The fresh mushrooms dropped in at the beginning also look more like common edible mushrooms and nothing like those commonly found to contain Psilocybin. I am willing to be wrong on that last point in case they were a more obscure species containing Psilocybin, like Psilocybe Montana for example. But the point still stands about the laziness of research and the misrepresentation of what the most common species actually look like.

I hope this helps anyone looking to take a trip. I’ve done shrooms 3-4 times. Every time I tripped every trip seemed to start out the same way. First I would feel a strange sensation in my body then the trips started to kick in. The first few minutes of the the trip I would feel a bit sick sometimes my friends would even vomit (never happens to me) I would feel as if I were going too also but that would go away usually 20 so mins into my trips. I’ve experienced two bad trips. The bad trips would make my adrenaline pump very badly and I would sweat and I seemed to get very anxious, also when you’re tripping your visuals are modified in a strange way you don’t hallucinate but everything seems intense, which also messed with me during my bad trips. But it seemed every time I had a bad trip was when me and my friends weren’t stationary. If the setting changed like going around in public I seemed to get very paranoid and that would trigger my bad trips. Also when you’re tripping it is very easily be messed with. Sometimes you’ll miss interpret what someone just said to you. For example Like if you were sober you would completely be able to comprehend what someone just said to you, but when you’re tripping it is easy to completely flip around what they just said and it will have you completely feeling insane. That’s how I felt when I ate a cut and had a bad trip. But that’s basically how your trip is on shrooms. It highly depends on your environment and the people your with because the action around you will affect your trip (if that makes any sense) My good trips tho were fun and I actually had a spiritual experience before. And also another very big thing you’re mood before you go into the trip will also effect your trip. I have veered myself out of a bad trip before by just calming myself as much as I could and watching the stoned ape theory Lol surprisingly that led to more videos that led me into my spiritual trip. I’ve also heard benzos stop your trip so if your tripping to bad Xanax may help but I’m not completely sure about that. But I hope this helps in any way. Safe trips!

can't think of anything to comment so I'm just going to post a pancake recipe.
1 1/2 cups milk
1 egg
2 teaspoons vanilla extract
2 cups White Wings self-raising flour
1/4 teaspoon bicarbonate of soda
1/3 cup caster sugar
25g butter, melted
Whisk milk, egg and vanilla together in a jug. Sift flour and bicarbonate of soda into a bowl. Stir in sugar. Make a well in center. Add milk mixture. Whisk until just combined.
Step 2
Heat a large non-stick frying pan over medium heat. Brush pan with butter. Using 1/4 cup mixture per pancake, cook 2 pancakes for 3 to 4 minutes or until bubbles appear on surface. Turn and cook for 3 minutes or until cooked through. Transfer to a plate. Cover loosely with foil to keep warm. Repeat with remaining mixture, brushing pan with butter between batches.

I take mushrooms once a month. Ive been struggling with depression since I was 14. Ive taken anti depressants, tried smoking weed, exercising and eating healthy (which helped a little) but nothing was a sure fix. Just a bandaid ontop of deep wounds. After 10 years of trying almost everything, I decided to tap into shrooms, which have been known to decrease anxiety and depression. What I experienced was nothing short of a miracle. During my first trip I began to experience emotions I hadnt felt fully since I was a kid (joy, wonder, awe) which I never thought id be able to have again. 3 days later I felt as though my brain was resetting itself. I can now experience life to the fullest. This plant has cured my insomnia and brought back meaning to my life. These effects last for 6 weeks and when I start to feel my anxiety coming back I'll go for a hike and trip on half an 8th of magic mushrooms. It's incredible. I wish I could share this with the world without being deemed as a drug addict. Hopefully they'll be legalized soon

I don't understand why shrooms are illegal, I have been battling depression most of my life. As things sometimes go with depression I sought relief with drugs to keep myself happy. Well, a month back I tried shrooms for the first time... Well I didn't necessarily have a bad trip, I enjoyed the trip I had save for the first few hours. It started with an eighth of stargazers, I layed in my bed and waited for the trip to start, when it did it came with pain, as the trip continued it grew, time slowed down. It felt like weeks that I laid in my bed feeling this ever-growing pain in my chest. I experienced what is referred to as an ego-death. This experiences put my life into prospective, the pain was my depression, and I felt it overcome me until I felt my life force slip away. I have been clean ever since, quit everything cold turkey that day, haven't touched a drug since, my depression is mostly gone too. I can't even begin to explain how horrifying the experience was for me at first, but now I am thankful, because I have my life back, and now I'm actually trying to make something of myself, rather than focus on one thing and one thing only, my crutch, getting that next high.

I ate some shrooms (about 1.7-2.0 g's, half an eighth) this morning.
When I woke up I cut 3 limes in half, squeezed the juice into a cup and
then I ground up my shrooms, chunky/powdery, tossed em into the cup
& let it sit for about 30 minutes. I took a shot of Lime mixed with
shrooms, pretty gross (will never get used to that taste) lol. But I
felt it within 25 minutes. SO woke up before 9:30 a.m, got everything prepared and waited for the house to be empty, took the shrooms around 10:30
started feeling em before 11 a.m.

I stayed in, it was my first time tripping in the morning, let alone at
home.

IT WAS INTENSE, good lordy god all mighty, (I'm not even a believer lol
just phrasing and saying stuff)

LET ME TELL YA. (lol its not my first time doing shrooms but its been
about a year since I last did them) I was gonna do the whole eighth but
I'm glad I did not, that would have wild and tooo much. The half was
perfect, the trip was nice and smooth, there was some paranoid/ anxious
feelings but that went away as I told myself all is well (I tend to
psych myself out and get really anxious before, which is never good but
that's me, the feeling does go away)

I spent the morning drawing, listening to music, thinking, playing fetch
with my dog, I took a shower, I used the Gear VR and tripped out on
some awesome northern lights, and beautiful night time shots of the sky
where you can see all sorts of colors and stars. but the most trippy
thing was a moment in VR

I was sitting on top of a mountain, staring into the sunset behind me a
valley and above, stars and colors from the nebula's above - when-
suddenly, The rocks and boulders around me became People, people who
were implanted into the earth, stuck there, as if volcanic ash had
smothered them and held them with such pressure and force they too,
themselves became rock/ash.

And I as I turned my head, my mind now racing as I hallucinate, I turn
to my right, where another group of boulders lay, and as they come into
view, they took the shape of a dead new born child, which at this point
was too much for me and my mind went haywire, creating a story for the
"dead boulder people" that were all around me. and at the very top I
stood with the last turn I did before taking off the VR I stared into
the pile of rocks infront of me and saw a man reaching out for help and
at that moment I could feel his desperate need for help, even though
nothing was there.
It was crazy powerful and fun. lol

For me it was like I could see things that were hallucinations but there was no doubt that they were. I never saw anything that I thought was real when it actually wasn't. Like I looked at a gym bag out of my peripheral and it appeared to be a little dog-like creature with small paws, triangular ears, a mischievous grin and a little tail but I still understood that it was just a gym bag being visually altered by the shrooms. I also saw the treetops bending down as if melting and the walls seemed to be in motion as well. One friend put it well when he came inside the cabin saying it was "like being in a fun house."                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              It was the internal thoughts and ideas I had that kinda got to me. I started having a conversation with a buddy of mine that got very dark and whacked out very fast and it just spiraled out of control. We were talking about how violent and war-hungry humans are and it was like as we were talking about it I could see and hear it all, almost feel it even. I saw waves of armies marching, flickering lights of explosions, men being skewered by pikes and spears, fighting in brutal hand-to-hand combat. It was as if I could actually grasp the full weight and impact of ten thousand years of conflict and bloodshed and merciless death. It was all very heavy and at one point I had to tell him to chill, bring it down a few notches because it was all too much.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    I wasn't afraid really - it was just super intense.But as those who've tried shrooms can tell you, it was exactly like I just described but also nothing like it at the same time. That is to say, I was 100% aware that I was just in the woods outside of a cabin chatting with my buddy but I was also simultaneously able to delve into this other world that was being created by my own mind. Words are truly inadequate to describe the experience tbh.

SAFETY WARNING!!!   The mushrooms that are being talked about are mostly from the genus Psilocobe, and those are relatively safe, except for the fact that it is a felony to possess, buy, and sell them.  HOWEVER, the mushrooms PICTURED in this video are Amanita muscaria.  They do not produce psilocybin or psilocin.  Instead they produce muscimal.  Nearly all Amanita species are highly toxic and can be deadly.  Even the muscaria and pantherina mushrooms are lethal in high doses.

You don't see demons running around or anything like that, a bad trip consists purely from your thoughts, when you are sober you can stop thinking about something if it bothers you or is creepy, but on a trip you enter thought loops where the only thing you can think about is death for example,  your perception is also controlled by your thoughts somewhat, I remember tripping in a forest with a friend and when I looked at a dead flower, the grass started turning black and I started hearing creepy trickling like bugs crawling on glass. The thought loops you have aren't in any language as well, when you think of someone's face that's partially what it feels like, you simply experience the thought you don't hear or think it. I remember I started having a trip where the entire world turned into insects (most of my bad trips involve insects since that's my main fear) I could only hear insect noises like crawling and buzzing to the point where I couldn't even Hear my friend talking to me and felt my skin being stung by millions of bees while maggots crawled underneath it. But you have to understand that you ultimately control the bad trip, these were all before I learned how to control bad trips, usually the only people who get bad trips are the ones who didn't have the right set and setting and didn't know what they were getting themselves into. Everyone should have one bad trip within shrooms as I saw mine as a lesson, I realized even though I was being infested by millions of bugs I came out fine and that ultimately they can't hurt you. Every bad trip happens for a reason and you should always try to understand why.

LSD is more of an epic visual journey taken during music events, nature walks, art galleries, etc. Lights become brighter and warmer, objects or walls around you look like they're moving or warping, the numbers and images on your phone look shaky or smeared in vibrant colors, sounds around you sound intertwined and closer than it appears, music sounds amazing especially when you close your eyes (Feels like you're at a concert that is playing the song with each instrument arranged in different stereo field positions around your head). Closing your eyes lets your mind wander into imaginations and deep life thoughts while also experiencing a body uplift or repair of your troubles in life. In my experience; I closed my eyes while in bed and felt like my entire body had literally shattered into pieces with each piece reflecting each part of my life. I almost couldn't feel my body and felt detached from reality at some moments but keeping yourself intact is easy if you know how to handle yourself responsibly emotionally. My mind was trying to pick up the pieces to put back together slowly while questioning my inner soul and putting me at peace with some decisions I've made. Overall, it's a funny visual high that slowly comes down to a spiritual understanding of your life. I recommend it to most but if you have deep emotional troubles or scare easily then don't do it; or at least take less than the normal dosage to see if you handle it. Real easy to overdose and spiral into a pit of doom with scary visuals regardless if you open or close your eyes.

This show is great, but psilocybin does not cause hallucinations, it causes illusions. As the John Hopkins study states "In medicine they are often called “hallucinogens, “ although they rarely cause “hallucinations” in the sense of seeing or hearing things that are not there." Instead most of the time those on psilocybin experience illusions, "a perception, as of visual stimuli (optical illusion) that represents what is perceived in a way different from the way it is in reality."

Great video but as a mycologist I have to comment: THE MUSHROOMS DEPICTED ARE NOT THE "MAGIC" MUSHROOMS!!!
The ones that are drawn by the hand (the red and white ones) are Amanita muscaria or Fly Agaric which contains, among other things the chemical Muscimol which is classified as a "deliriant" and not a full hallucinogen, If you are out in the woods and see large, bright red mushrooms with white spots on the cap DO NOT EAT THEM. They may get you high but you also get really sick with nausea, vomiting and stomach pains. And it isn't a true hallucinogenic trip, you will just be delirious and sick.

And the mushrooms that are thrown on the table at 0:13 look like shiitake mushrooms or button Agaricus, both are the kind you buy in stores to put on your salad or in your stew, NOT at all poisonous or hallucinogenic

As someone who has grown multiple species of psilocyben cubensis over the years there are many things that still intrigue me about it. First off, we spend so much time and care being so cautious to avoid contamination and creating the perfect environment for them to cultivate. Yet, a simple spore of green mold can kill a whole 55 gallon tub already colonized. But then they grow naturally out in the wild with no controlled environment and often THRIVE. I'll never understand nature and it's gimmicks.

The reason why I came across this video is because, about 2 months ago. My girlfriend of 3 years and I took acid. We had already tried it about 5 other times and they were pretty amazing experiences. This last time was different though. While we were in our room tripping, i started noticing that she was saying some strange things. Obviously people say weird things while being on acid but this time it was different. Its almost like she lost her sense of reality. I tried to brush it off and tell myself that her behavior was normal but during mid trip i really couldn't stop thinking about it, so i turned down the volume from the music she had playing and I started trying to have a conversation with her, like asking her what was on her mind and how she felt, different things like that. All i got was a long blank stare and a "huh". At this point i started noticing that she wasn't acting the same anymore. Ever since that day she has not been the same. She's very quite now and she's been day dreaming a lot. I can't have a deep conversation with my girlfriend anymore, she shows a lack of feelings. I feel as if she died that night and now I'm living with a whole different person and all i can do is feel guilty about what happen. Lsd isn't a game, I use to think it was okay and would have very enlightening experiences, something like that could never happen to me. I would give anything to have the love of my life back. Take notice, i hope someone reads this and realizes that lsd isn't a joke. I wouldn't want anyone to go what im going through. All I ask is If you're going to take it, please don't give non to anyone else because you never know when something like this could happen.

Tried shrooms 7 times, got 6 curious fun mind expanding trips and 1 bad trip.  The good trips reveal a lot and genuinely felt like they left a magical pleasant feeling, but even the bad trip also eventually left this feeling though it made me more aware of their different kinds of power.  Do not underestimate them and take way more than you're used to, go gradual for sure.  If you are new, start very gradual like 1g and wait 2 hours just in case you have hyper sensitivity.  If you are a very sensitive person, no more than a gram for starters.  My trips were usually fine with 2-3g. When I took 6g is when I wasn't used to the intensity and even the slightest anxiety could feel like a punch to the chest of panic.  If you've had panic episodes already, then you have already experienced this sensation somewhat, at-least the fear part.  The hallucinations are not clear enough to be scary or pleasant really, just mild and your mind's interpretation of it's own hallucinations will determine if they shall be fun or scary.  You will learn much of how to relax if it gets intense and if it gets fun then you will learn more of how to express yourself.  If you are even remotely philosophical, the psilocybin will provide great joy in expanding these curious metaphysical wonders - take it as joy.  If you're stuck in a panic (even now) it's only a few hours, you'll get over it - distract yourself with wisdom, listen to Terence McKenna or maybe some very simple Tibetan Meditation bowls. Don't blast very intense music.  Turn inward to yourself and tell yourself, "you're a calm explorer now, we're doing just fine. enjoy the warmth."

Mushrooms can be a magical and profound experience. They show you that consciousness and reality as you have come to understand them may not be the only state of being. Mushrooms can give you insight into your ego - you may discover that your fears and insecurities might not be important as you once perceived them to be. There may come a time during your trip that you find yourself  resisting - in this moment it may feel euphoric to stop, take a deep breath and accept yourself and the universe as it is and all the beauty it contains. The realization of this harmony between yourself and the universe may be what you strive for after the trip ends. The time I have been the most happy on shrooms is when I found a peaceful place by the trees with a clear view of the night sky. The lights from stars, moon, satellites and planes can be mystical. The things I see when I close my eyes are truly incredible. You can actually feel music running through your body.

I can't give away too much here, but this is not necessarily true. In fact, many people who are on a trip are more self-aware than most sober people. And regarding planning, there's a deep philosophical reason why many people on a trip DON'T plan ahead, and then there are people who can run through precise step-by-step details of where they are at any given moment to the end result of many potential situations more accurately than a "sober" person. 

This stuff needs to be studied much more than it is. And if it's a controlled substance, then it needs to be controlled, rather than restricted. It has shown significant medical use in psychological disorders, addiction, and more.

Not that anyone is going to read this, but I feel the need to set the record straight..

As a former vape shop employee, and mixologist (I enjoy fancy titles), I can tell you for a fact that the only ingredients that go into e-juice are:

- Propylene Glycol ( PG is a humectant, meaning that it keeps things moist) This is what will produce the 'throat hit', which is what makes most standard e-liquid recipes (70% PG / 30%VG) FEEL like you're still smoking. It does, admittedly, cause respiratory irritation in some cases. PG is also used, in many cases, as a flavour carrier in many artificially flavoured items. Contrary to popular belief, PG is NOT antifreeze, and should not be confused with the much more toxic POLYpropylene Glycol. Though PG is in fact IN antifreeze, it is often there solely to reduce the toxicity of the liquid. The fact that it has a very low freezing point is simply a bonus.

-Vegetable Glycerin (Also a humectant) VG is often the go-to for those with sensitivity to PG - meaning that, if you have an issue with PG, higher/100% VG mixes are available to you. VG is what will produce the visible 'smoke effect, or vapour that you see when you puff on your vape.
VG is commonly used in asthma inhalers, as well as incubation tanks for pre-mature infants. It is a chemical that has been widely used (as with PG) since the mid 1920's with no adverse health effects.

-Nicotine. Nic on its own has absolutely zero (proven) adverse health effects aside from its obvious, and highly addictive nature. If you drink coffee on even a semi-regular basis, then nicotine is about as dangerous as the caffeine is. Luckily, e-cigs afford you the luxury of stepping down in nic content as you go, effectively reducing your intake to zero over time, if you so choose.

-Flavouring. This is where things get complicated. Certain flavourings do in fact contain Acetoin and Diacetyl, which are both very much harmful substances. Luckily, this is yet another point that this video takes out of context. The e-cig industry, while not governmentally regulated, is in fact SELF-regulated. The common thread with most of the larger (and reputable) vendors is that any liquids sold are open to testing, and the results are often posted for anyone who cares to see.
The main flavours that you will see containing these harmful substances will be creamy/custard-like flavours. Even here, the industry is pushing hard for a new, non-harmful version of these flavours to be researched and produced.


So, in conclusion, I will never tell you that ANYTHING is 100% safe.
The components in e-liquid are some that have been used WIDELY for almost a century now, and have had zero resulting illnesses or deaths. These are truly a far safer alternative for cigarettes, but should be treated as exactly that: an alternative - not a cure.
You would be a fool to use anything in life without doing your research (in this case, both on vaping in general, and on whichever company you choose to purchase from).

NEVER let a video like this sway your judgement. Do your due diligence, and find out the truth for yourself, instead of watching a couple videos on YouTube, or any news outlet before passing judgement.

(A pseudohallucination is an involuntary sensory experience vivid enough to be regarded as a hallucination, but recognised by the patient not to be the result of external stimuli. Unlike normal hallucination, which occurs when one sees, hears, smells, tastes or feels something that is not there, with a compelling feeling or thought that it is real, pseudohallucinations are recognised by the person as unreal.)

I over-dosed on shrooms once and had a terrible time. I'm not talking just a little extra--I'm talking a big dose for two people, let alone one. It was really stupid: I'm really lucky I didn't get myself into deep trouble. It was the most intense experience I've ever had.

I forgot that I had taken mushrooms and believed that I was simply insane.I was grieving that my family had lost me; wondering if anyone would take care of me. By the climax, I couldn't tell if things like people, my stuf, or my loved ones were real or just figments of my imagination. I didn't even know what I meant by "real." I completely lost my sense of identity, experienced several hours of having NO IDEA who or what I was, or even the meaning of "I." I wondered if the universe had ended. I wondered if I WAS the universe; how would I know? Long story short, object permanence was completely gone.

I certainly WOULD NOT recommend such a dose for anyone else. But retrospectively, I can appreciate the insight it gave me as much as any "good trip." Certainly, a once in a life-time ordeal...

I have experimented with mushrooms for a month and have had a great perspective shift of the world.

In my opinion, The 22% who had a negative effect due to shrooms already had some issue they had not resolved prior to ingesting shrooms. If not, then the environment they were tested in did not make them feel comfortable. All the criteria needs to be met before ingesting it, one negative stimuli near you can alter the experience ( it could be an object, a person or something playing on TV). 

Recommended settings for the best experience -
1. Quiet and peaceful home or similar environment, outdoors is fine only if you know there will be no one disturbing you for at least 24 hours.
2. Start small dose and go from there, 5g suited me although 4g would have similar effect.
3. To avoid bad taste, put on top of a warm pizza slice and gobble it down.
4. To counteract the nausea effect, smoke/vape a bowl.
5. When you feel the tingling sensation come on, don't panic just relax.
6. Don't watch TV or silly movies, instead play some good psychedelic trance or chillout music. You don't need visuals like movies or tv, they will make the trip worse.
7. Your company will greatly affect your experience, a bad company such as a stubborn friend is a recipe for a bad trip since he or she will dictate what you do on the trip.

My advice - Do it by yourself.

Incoming pedantry:  The drawn depictions of the mushrooms in question are all amanitas, not psilocybe (or the other myriad of fungal families which produce psilocybin via their standard biological pathways).  Amanita Muscaria, the variety of mushroom depicted in the drawings which are red capped with white worts and a white stem, contain no psilocybin.  Instead, they contain muscimol and ibotenic acid, which are not exactly psychedelics, but disssociatives.  

I bring it up because of the afore mentioned pedantry, but also because the experience of each respective mushroom type is wildly different.  So, if people watching this become intrigued and want to try some of their own, and they take amanita muscaria, they are almost certainly going to have a bad time.  You won't get any familiar psychedelic experiences, but a dissociative one instead, which is often very unpleasant.  

The problem going the other way though, is that psilocybe mushrooms look exactly like a myriad of actual toxic mushrooms (of the "little brown mushroom" type) which can, has, and will kill people who make the mistake.  Point is; unless you have some experience identifying wild mushrooms, DON'T EAT THEM.  Some psychedelic mushrooms look exactly like some toxic ones, and only an experienced eye and a close examination will know the difference.  Some species of galina (a VERY toxic mushroom) are known to grow along side psilocybe mushrooms, and even experienced mycologists have a hard time distinguishing them.   People who find a batch of wildly growing mushrooms HAVE to examine each once, just to be sure they don't accidentally eat a galina along with the psilocybe.

 If you simply have to sate your curiosity and go looking for these things, do some research first.  If you know someone who has experience identifying them, bring them along.  Examine each one, and just in general, stay away from the amanita (the red capped with white worts variety) unless you know what you're getting yourself into.

End pedantry.

I've done mushrooms a lot and mostly had positive experiences. It felt like being a little kid again and you have this great understanding of how the universe works and how everything is connected. There is also the heightened senses where sounds and visuals are intensified and everything looks and sounds amazing. But the 3 bad trips I had were really scary. I had to stop doing shroomz and all hallucinogens after 2 really bad back-to-back trips. I think I went one toke over the line. Way over. But it would be good to see some more scientific studies on how mushrooms affect people, especially those like me who have PTSD, depression, and anxiety. Hallucinogens helped me realize a lot of things about myself and the world. It helped me understand that reality is just an illusion and this is all a dream. But in order to wake up from this nightmare, I must create my own new reality. Not an easy thing to do!

It's been decades since my last trip but I remember that every time I indulged my sense of being in both time and place were the same.

To put it another way, the first experience seemed to set the stage, so to speak, for the following times as I would seem to go back to the time and place of the first experience.

I thought that this was weird in itself and could not explain it but the video shows that new neurons form and maybe I 'traveled' down my own 'rabbit hole' following the first pathway of my experiences.

This is why I don't trust "spiritual" claims to the effect of "I felt a powerful being" or "I became connected with the universe" or whatever. This kind of transcendent experience if often used as testimonial, subjective evidence of the supernatural (including God) and any skepticism is met with snark like "you just have to experience it to know what I know." Look, it's not that you didn't feel something very powerfully, but this shows neatly how having powerful feelings isn't necessarily indicative of a supernatural cause, and it doesn't become so just because you have no satisfying natural explanation.

Red mushroom with white spots = Amanita muscaria.

Amanita muscaria contain the chemicals muscarine + muscimol.

Psilocybin mushrooms contain the chemicals psilocybin and psilocin.

Both can cause hallucinogenic effects, but they are different. Amanita muscaria is poisonous while psilocybin mushrooms are not. They should not be confused with each other.

In terms of cost/benefit to society, if a significant proportion of people who try the drug end up traumatised because of it (possibly aggravating other mental illnesses) then it's not worth it. You also have people who experience a good trip, but end up jumping off a roof or something due to the hallucinations. Having said that, cigarettes and alcohol seem to be much worse, and they are legal, so maybe magic mushrooms should be too. 

Regardless, there should defiantly be more research done into it though, because it sounds like magic mushrooms could have medically beneficial properties.

Ok so in the netherlands they sell some sorts (others were banned) of magic mushrooms non-illegally (much like weed) and sellers have to give advice on their usage. For all those outside the Netherlands who saw this video and got curious about trying some, here's what I can remember from what I was told/experienced myself.

- Don't eat or drink heavily right before ingesting
- Don't eat or drink while you're high on them. The effects will wear off. Make sure you've eaten enough a few hours beforehand.
- Do not, under any circumstance, mix the usage with any other drug (including alcohol). Things can get really bad. For example, those people who jumped off a roof in Amsterdam because they thought they could fly? Yeah. They started mixing stuff.
- The effects typically last up to six hours
- Have somebody sober watch over you
- Mushrooms are really gross, have some water near you to wash your mouth with afterwards (don't swallow the water, though!)
- Don't get on the road while you're still high on them, obviously

If you're experiencing those frightening visions or feelings, here's what you should do:
- Remember that nearly every one will experience such a "bad trip" (as they're called). They typically last ten minutes if you can take a hold of yourself. It's impossible for a bad trip to continue outside of the six hours the shrooms have an effect on you, regardless of what some movies or scare blogs/stories may say.
- Stay calm. It's a normal thing. It will be over before you know it.
- Get distracted, listen to some music, do something.
- Do not force yourself in trying to actively shape your thoughts. Don't tell yourself to think of happy things. This will only cause you to "remember" that you're having a bad trip, thus worsening or elongating the bad trip. Distracting yourself will help.
- If you really can't take it any longer, have some sugar and drink some water. The effects will wear off completely, though, so do use this as a last resort.

You are the boss of your own mind. The deal is that, especially on psychedelic drugs, the rules of how to take control tend to be a bit different from what you may expect. "Mindfulness" won't work, for example. You're far too clever, too psychologically insightful on shrooms to fall for it.

Also, know that you may realise or feel certain things you have never thought or experienced before. These things can be very personal and very painful (also very joyful, of course). Typically you get to know yourself a lot better, it's an eye-opener. For example, I learned that I find life exceptionally useless but also that I couldn't give a shit less about that. Also some other stuff, but, as I said, it can become very personal.
As for the hallucinogenic side of things: I started walking like a fucking madman, heaving my legs all the way up until my calves touched my breast and belly because walking felt funny; this one guy who got a lil ill from the foul taste of the shrooms started looking like a literal corpse (a greenish pale and a v boney face, nothing TWD-like); I got this near-panoramic view, as if I had switched from watching my own life on my phone to sitting in a cinema; the leaves of the trees above us started moving very calmingly, in line with the light that fell through them and idk it was just beautiful; and that was about it, I spend a good 4 hours staring at the leaves so yeah
